Item ID7158

The dragon 2h sword is one of the strongest two-handed swords in Old School RuneScape, requiring level 60 Attack to wield. Due to its slow attacking speed and the fact that it cannot be used with a shield or defender, many players prefer using other dragon weaponry instead, such as the dragon scimitar.

It is dropped by most Wilderness bosses and the Kalphite Queen.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performing the dragon 2h sword's special attack, Powerstab.

The dragon 2h sword has a special attack, Powerstab, which consumes 60% of the player's special attack energy. When used in a multi-combat area, the attack hits all targets within 1 square of the player, including the one they are standing on; no more than 14 NPCs or three players can be hit at one time with this attack. However, there are no advantages when using this attack in a single-combat area.

It can be especially useful while training in multi-combat areas, like those where one may fight Bandits or Skeleton Monkeys. The attack is also useful in Nightmare Zone, when used in with the "Power Surge" power-up that gives the player temporary infinite special attacks. This allows the player to deal massive amounts of damage to many surrounding enemies at once, repeatedly. It also proves useful when playing Pest Control, where multiple Spinners may be found on a single space; using the special attack can distract the mass from healing the portal. It is also uncommonly used during the fight against The Nightmare when husks are summoned around the player. The special attack is also ideal when many husks or parasites are on adjacent tiles, able to damage many at once. Additionally, the sword has the same crush bonus as the obsidian maul and Godsword, making it an effective crush weapon.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 February 2020
(update)

The dragon 2h sword will no longer skip the targeted NPC or player when hitting multiple targets in multi-way combat areas.

26 April 2019
 Hotfix

The dragon 2h sword's special attack was limited to three targets in PVP, to prevent unintentionally high experience rates.[1]

Date unknown

On release of Revenants, they could drop the dragon 2h sword. It was later removed from their drop table after an update.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 26 April 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Old School RuneScape: "A hotfix has been deployed to cap the Crystal halberd, Crystal halberd (i), Dragon halberd, and Dragon two handed sword special attacks to hit a maximum of 3 players in PvP. This is to prevent players achieving unintentionally high xp rates while a long term fix is discussed."

[[File:Dragon 2h sword detail.png|left|120px]]
The '''dragon 2h sword''' is one of the strongest [[two-handed sword]]s in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'', requiring level 60 [[Attack]] to wield. Due to its slow attacking speed and the fact that it cannot be used with a [[shield]] or [[defender]], many players prefer using other dragon weaponry instead, such as the [[dragon scimitar]].

It is dropped by most [[Wilderness bosses]] and the [[Kalphite Queen]].

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|2h Sword}}

==Special attack==
[[File:Powerstab.gif|thumb|A player performing the dragon 2h sword's special attack, ''Powerstab''.]]
The dragon 2h sword has a [[special attack]], ''Powerstab'', which consumes 60% of the player's special attack energy. When used in a [[multi-combat area]], the attack hits all targets within 1 square of the player, including the one they are standing on; no more than 14 NPCs or three players can be hit at one time with this attack. However, there are no advantages when using this attack in a single-combat area.

It can be especially useful while training in multi-combat areas, like those where one may fight [[Bandit (Bandit Camp)|Bandits]] or [[Skeleton Monkeys]]. The attack is also useful in [[Nightmare Zone/Strategies|Nightmare Zone]], when used in with the "Power Surge" power-up that gives the player temporary infinite special attacks. This allows the player to deal massive amounts of damage to many surrounding enemies at once, repeatedly. It also proves useful when playing [[Pest Control]], where multiple [[Spinner]]s may be found on a single space; using the special attack can distract the mass from healing the portal. It is also uncommonly used during the fight against [[The Nightmare]] when [[husk]]s are summoned around the player. The special attack is also ideal when many husks or [[parasite]]s are on adjacent tiles, able to damage many at once. Additionally, the sword has the same crush bonus as the [[obsidian maul]] and [[Godsword]], making it an effective crush weapon.
